lead_paragraph: SABATINE--Carol Roth. Died peacefully of a rare neurodegenerative brain disease on November 12th, at the age of 80. A native of Port Huron, Michigan (born July 3, 1935), she graduated from the University of Michigan Architecture and Design School (1957). Soon after, she moved to New York City to begin a career in interior design. In 1960, she married Leo E. Sabatine (died 1976). She dedicated her life to raising her two sons and to volunteer work. She was a fixture in Brooklyn Heights, the neighborhood where she lived for over 40 years. She will be remembered for her kindness, elegance and utmost generosity. Along with serving on the vestry at Grace Church Brooklyn Heights, she served numerous executive positions, including president, for the Brooklyn Woman's Exchange and Brooklyn Heights Garden Club. She had a great interest in the arts and culture, loved travelling with her sons, enjoyed playing and watching tennis, and spending time at her beloved beach club. Her brain was donated for research to the Mass General Hospital Frontotemporal Disorders Unit. She is survived by her loving sons, Michael and Edward, by her daughter-in-law Marcela, and granddaughter, Maria Carolina, brother, John R. Roth (Karen), sisters Miriam L. Roth and Judith R. Armstrong (Ned). A memorial service will be held at Grace Church Brooklyn Heights, at 11am on January 9th. 1/3
